body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.8.0

Using exactly the same configs for both environment

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

macOS 12.5 (M2 Air 2022), Arch linux (kernel 6.0.2-arch1-1)

### Terminal name/version

Alacritty for both

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

brew for macOS, yay for Arch

### How to reproduce the issue

run `nvim --startuptime log.vim` on both operating system

### Expected behavior

The startup time for both operating system should be about the same 

### Actual behavior

# Problem
The startuptime on macOS takes about 200ms while Arch Linux takes only 40ms to start.

# Startuptime on macOS


comment_data.body: That's just macOS being slower on accessing (some) files, nothing to do with Neovim.
mine takes 100 ms on statup. On arch linux

title: Slow startup on macos
